dict.acceptation: 下方的；在底部的；较低级的；

sent.orig: Higher highs and higher lows mark an uptrend, lower highs and lower lows mark a downtrend.
sent.trans: 高于旧高和旧低标志著向上的走向，低于旧高和旧低标志著朝下的走向。

sent.orig: Publishers would have fewer returns lower stock-outs, higher inventory turns, lower write-offs and more timely reprints.
sent.trans: 出版商则会有更低的退货率和库存短缺率，更高的存货变动率，更低的销帐率并得以实现更加及时的重印。
低成本就意味着低价格。

sent.orig: The reduced weight leads to a lower required drive force and subsequently lower energy consumption.
sent.trans: 体重减少导致了较低的需要驱动力，随后降低能耗。

sent.orig: The little flame of life sinks lower and lower.
sent.trans: 生命的细小的火焰越来越微弱。
